com.paypal.merchant.sdk
Interface MerchantManager

public interface MerchantManager

The MerchantManager is mainly meant to perform merchant related activities such as:
> Initialize the SDK with the merchant credentials that would be used while making all the backed calls.
> "Check-in" a merchant based on a geo location to accept customer "check-in" payments.
> "Check-out" the merchant if no more "check-in" related payments are accepted.
> Set the merchant logo for other "checked-in" clients to see.
> Remove the currently set merchant logo.
> Get a list of all the "checked-in" clients/customer around the merchant's location in order to accept payments.

The MerchantManager interface is the gateway to access anything & everything
related to a merchant.

MerchantManager is initialized as soon as the merchant login is successful. This
happens when the OAuth process is complete and the application initializes the Merchant
info from the data received during this process.

The MerchantManager APIs perform all operations against the "Active Merchant".
In other words, once the initialization is done, the active merchant is set internally
and can only be changed when the merchant logs out and another one logs in

One of the critical tasks managed by the MerchantManager interface is setting up
the merchant's current location, handling client checkins etc.

Nested Class Summary
static class MerchantManager.MerchantErrors
          This enum consists of all the different error types that would be returned by the SDK through the response handlers while invoking the merchant manager APIs.

Method Detail

registerMerchantListener

void registerMerchantListener(MerchantListener listener)
Use this API to register a listener that will be notified with changes in the checked in clients list
See the documentation for the MerchantListener for more details on the callback APIs

Parameters:
listener - this is the listener object that will be called back when the clients list status changes

unregisterMerchantListener

void unregisterMerchantListener(MerchantListener listener)
Use this API to un-register a listener that will be notified with changes in the checked in clients list
See the documentation for the MerchantListener for more details on the callback APIs

Parameters:
listener - this is the listener object that will be called back when the clients list status changes

getActiveMerchant

Merchant getActiveMerchant()
Returns the currently active merchant object. The Merchant object contains
useful information about the Merchant such as address, business name etc that
the application can use for various purposes. For example, the app want the
Merchant's address info so it can create a custom receipt and send it to the
printer

Returns:
merchant - the merchant object that is currently active. This value can be null
indicating that no merchant is logged in into the system. Note that this means that you will
not be able to invoke most of the APIs as the currently active merchant object is required
for most operations

checkinMerchant

void checkinMerchant(String bannerMessage,
                     DefaultResponseHandler<Merchant,PPError<MerchantManager.MerchantErrors>> responseHandler)
Use this API to indicate that the Merchant is interested in broadcasting
his/her current location. This is required before the merchant can take
payments from customers checked in via PayPal

Parameters:
bannerMessage - The banner message is a useful string that will show up on the consumer's
side. For example, it could be something like: "on the corner of 12th & A st"

or something like "running specials now!"
responseHandler - This response handler would notify the caller whether the check out process was a success or a failure. In case of a success, the merchant object is returned back that would contain the checked in merchant's location info such as the all important location ID, geo co-ordinates, etc. Customers could then search this location ID in order to make a payment to the merchant. In case of failure, an error object describing the failure in the form a MerchantErrors enum would be returned back.

checkoutMerchant

void checkoutMerchant(DefaultResponseHandler<Merchant,PPError<MerchantManager.MerchantErrors>> responseHandler)
Use this API to checkout the merchant from a given location.
The merchant will not be visible to any of clients and hence cannot take any payments from clients that want to pay via "checked in" methodology.

Parameters:
responseHandler - This response handler would notify the caller whether the check out process was a success or a failure. In case of a success, the merchant object is returned back with the merchant's location info being set to NULL. In case of failure, an error object describing the failure in the form of a MerchantErrors enum would be returned back.

getCheckedInClientsList

void getCheckedInClientsList(DefaultResponseHandler<List<CheckedInClient>,PPError<MerchantManager.MerchantErrors>> responseHandler)
Use this API to request an update to the checked in clients list.
All the clients that are currently checked into the merchant's location would be retrieved and the merchant can select a customer and take a payment from them.

Parameters:
responseHandler - The responseHandler would notify the caller with the list of checked in clients in case of a success and an error object describing the failure in the form of a MerchantErrors enum would be returned back in case of failure.

NOTE: Ideally, the notification of an updated client list should happen automatically
without the application having to invoke this API. However, we do not currently support
automatic update of the list. In future, once this feature becomes available this API would get
deprecated.

The other thing to keep in mind is that this API does not return the delta between what was
returned previously and the current list. Instead, every time the API is called the entire list
is sent back up through the closure callback.

getCheckedInMerchantLocationsList

void getCheckedInMerchantLocationsList(DefaultResponseHandler<List<CheckedInMerchantLocation>,PPError<MerchantManager.MerchantErrors>> responseHandler)
Use this API to request an update to the checked in merchant's location list.
All the locations where the merchant is currently checked in would be retrieved. This API could be used if the merchant would like to know on what location(s) they are checked in.

Parameters:
responseHandler - The responseHandler would notify the caller with the list of checked in merchant locations in case of a success and an error object describing the failure in the form of a MerchantErrors enum would be returned back in case of failure.

setMerchantLogo

void setMerchantLogo(android.graphics.Bitmap image,
                     DefaultResponseHandler<Merchant,PPError<MerchantManager.MerchantErrors>> responseHandler)
This method is to be called when we would like to set a logo for the merchant, that would be visible to
to all the clients/consumers.

Parameters:
image - this represents the image stored locally on the device.
Currently, the supported image formats are: JPG and PNG.
responseHandler - The responseHandler would notify the caller with the active merchant object in case of a success and an error object describing the failure in the form of a MerchantErrors enum would be returned back in case of failure.

removeMerchantLogo

void removeMerchantLogo(DefaultResponseHandler<Merchant,PPError<MerchantManager.MerchantErrors>> responseHandler)
This method is to be called when a merchant wants to remove this currently set logo.

Parameters:
responseHandler - The responseHandler would notify the caller with the active merchant object in case of a success and an error object describing the failure in the form of a MerchantErrors enum would be returned back in case of failure.

getMerchantLogo

void getMerchantLogo(DefaultResponseHandler<android.graphics.Bitmap,PPError<MerchantManager.MerchantErrors>> responseHandler)
This method retrieves the merchant logo that is currently been set for the merchant.

Parameters:
responseHandler - The responseHandler would notify the caller with the merchant logo bitmap in case of a success and an error object describing the failure in the form of a MerchantErrors enum would be returned back in case of failure.
